greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows T(n, m) = sigma^*_(n-m)(m), n >= 1, m = 1, 2, ..., n, with sigma^*_(k)(n) given in a comment in A279395.
comment: The array A(k, n) = sigma^*_(k)(n) (notation of the Hardy reference, given also in a comment in A279395) = Sum_{ d >= 1, d divides n} (-1)^(n-d)*d^k, for k >= 0 and n >=1, has the rows A112329, A113184, A064027, A008457, A279395, for k=0..4.
The triangle T(n, m) is obtained from the array A(k, n) read by upwards antidiagonals, with offset n=1.
The diagonals of triangle T are the rows of the array A. Each diagonal is multiplicative. See the given A-numbers above.
The row sums are given in A279397.
The column sums (with offset 0) are A000012, A000225, A034472, A099393, A034474, .. with o.g.f. G(m, z) = (-1)^m*Sum_{d  | m} (-1)^d/(1 - d*z), m >= 1.
reference: G. H. Hardy, Ramanujan: twelve lectures on subjects suggested by his life and work, AMS Chelsea Publishing, Providence, Rhode Island, 2002, p. 142.
formula: T(n, m) = Sum_{ d >= 1, d divides m} (-1)^(m-d)*d^(n-m) = sigma^*_(n-m)(m), n >= 1, m = 1,2, ..., n. For the definition of
sigma^*_(k)(n) see the Hardy reference or a comment in A279395.
O.g.f triangle T: G(z, x) = Sum_{m>=0}
G(m, z)*(x*z)^m, with the column o.g.f. G( m, z) (with offset 0) given in a comment above.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jan 10 2017
